sn36.10:4.1: “Mendicants, these three feelings are born, rooted, sourced, and conditioned by contact.
sn36.10:4.4: Pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn36.10:4.5: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, the corresponding pleasant feeling ceases and stops.
sn36.10:4.6: Painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
sn36.10:4.7: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as painful, the corresponding painful feeling ceases and stops.
sn36.10:4.8: Neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.
sn36.10:4.9: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as neutral, the corresponding neutral feeling ceases and stops.
sn36.10:4.10: When you rub two sticks together, heat is generated and fire is produced.
sn36.10:4.11: But when you part the sticks and lay them aside, any corresponding heat ceases and stops.
sn36.10:4.12: In the same way, these three feelings are born, rooted, sourced, and conditioned by contact.
sn36.10:4.13: The appropriate feeling arises dependent on the corresponding contact.
sn36.10:4.14: When the corresponding contact ceases, the appropriate feeling ceases.”
